Robots and I

Posted by on March 10, 2019 · 3 mins read

The is no denying that I have been interested in programming and robotics since the very first time I was introduced to it. That was over 10 years ago when I went to visit a FIRST LEGO League state championship event as a spectator. The next fall, I had a team. Seven years later, that team won the highest award in FIRST LEGO League, the World Champion's award. Along the journey, many amazing things happened to me.

Winning World Champions in 2018

Failure is an Option

Contrary to the popular quotation, failure is an option. This is exactly what you learn in the FIRST program. It is okay to try and then fail and then try again. This is something I have learnt through my nine years in FIRST. In the 2018-19 season, I was on the Leadership Team and the Lead Programmer for FRC SHARP. Starting the 2018-19 season, I will be co-captain and Lead Programmer of my own FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC) team.

Programming an FRC robot

“Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.” - Samuel Beckett

Inspiring thousands

I have been building and programming non-competition robots for the last five years. I really enjoy mixing My robots have been featured on the Verge, Discovery Channel, CNET, LEGO YouTube, LEGO Facebook, LEGO Education YouTube, LEGO Education Facebook. My MINDSTORMS 3D Printer and dot-matrix printer

Robotics State, National and International Awards and Other Recognitions

* 2019 FIRST Nomination for Apple Engineering Technology Camp (top 75 out of 1000+)
* 2018 Selected to be one of 20 exhibitors at The LEGO House in Billund, Denmark to celebrate the 20th Anniversary of MINDSTORMS
* 2018 Selected to be one of 6 speakers on the 20th Anniversay of MINDSTORMS video.
* 2018 Commendation from Tom Wolf, Governor of Pennsylvania
* 2018 Proclamation from Allegheny County Pennsylvania
* 2017 Coach/Mentor of the Year, FIRST LEGO League World Championship
* 2017 Named MINDSTORMS Community Partner by the LEGO Group
* 2017 State Champion’s Award (1st place), Robot Performance (1st place) FIRST LEGO League
* 2016 Coach of State Champion’s Award (1st place) FIRST LEGO League
* 2016 First Place Programming, FIRST LEGO League World Championship
* 2016 Global Innovation Award (Top 20 out of 35,000)
* 2015 Tournament Champion (1st place), FIRST LEGO League World Invitational
* 2015 State Champion’s Award (1st place), Robot Performance (1st place) FIRST LEGO League
* 2014 First Place Research, FIRST LEGO League World Invitational
* 2014 First Place Research, FIRST LEGO League World Invitational
* 2014 State Champion’s Award (2nd place), Robot Performance (1st place) FIRST LEGO League
* 2013 State Champion’s Award (1st place), Robot Performance (1st place) FIRST LEGO League
* 2012 State Champion’s Award (2nd place), Robot Performance (2nd place) FIRST LEGO League
* 2011 State Champion’s Award (3rd place), Robot Performance (1st place) FIRST LEGO League
